#id=1
#text=Last week when I went biking on a trail with a friend , she rode over a nail and one of her bike tires was punctured .
#id=2
#text=We immediately stopped riding so that we could fix the problem , and we were lucky that it was n't too bad of an issue .
#id=3
#text=To fix it , we had to return home and take care of it with the tools we had there .
#id=4
#text=We turned the bike over so it was resting on the handlebars and the seat so that we would have access to the wheel very easily .
#id=5
#text=Upon spinning the wheel , we found the nail she had run over and removed it .
#id=6
#text=We had to release all the air from the tube to begin with , then take the tire off of the rim using tools called a tire levers .
#id=7
#text=After we had that off , we had to remove the tube from the tire and inflate it with enough air to find the hole .
#id=8
#text=We knew about where it would be .
#id=9
#text=Using a piece of my brother 's chalk , we marked where the hole was so we would n't lose the spot , and then we took the air out of the tube again .
#text=Using a patch kit designed for this kind of issue , we patched up the hole and put the tube back into the tire .
#text=We put the tire back on the wheel and re-inflated it .
#text=The patch worked perfectly and we were able to go out biking again the next day !
